lines.text: [On his dream of opening a dress shop]
Just because I'm rough 'n' dirty 'n' don't wear underwear, doesn't mean I'm not artistic.

[very drunk and slurring]
I got on a romance track. Then I got on a gunslinger's track. I gotta get back on that dentist's track!
[looks at the saloon girl, who is passed out with her head on the table]
Go ahead and laugh! Laugh all you like! I'm not a failure. I'm a dentist, a REAL dentist! And I'll tell you what I'm gonna do, I'm gonna spread dental health through the West like a plague!
[throws his arm out and falls down drunk]
I can't believe it. Tonight's our wedding night. In a few hours we'll stop, make camp, have a little supper, then... beddy-bye.
I'm in teeth. And I came out here all the way from Philadelphia, single-handed, to fight oral ignorance.

[drunk]
Failure, failure, failure, failure, failure, failure, failure. That's the story of my life, you know. Two things have always been my downfall - I have always been the most failure of anybody, and I'm too thin.

[drunk]
But I don't think you're too thin.
Ah, it's all bloat. Bloated thin failure! That's me.
[waggles both of his thumbs at himself]
I think you're wonderful. I just love a man that can't make his mark in life.
Uhuh Penny, uhuh Penny, she's really something, you know that?
[looks at saloon girl questioningly]

[nods affirmatively]
Uhuh.
You know she used me. She tricked me.
[tearfully]
She made me think that she loved me.

[shakes her head sympathetically]
Ohhh...
I should have known better.
[tearfully]
Nobody ever loved me. Did you know I had to take my own cousin to the graduation dance?

[shakes her head sympathetically and tearfully]
Ohhhhhhhhhh...
I threw up on her dress.

[slurring]
You are really my kind of guy.
You know something? You're a lot spunkier than I thought you were.
I get that from my mother.
[drunk]

[to the barkeep]
Brush your dentist twice a day, visit your toothbrush once a year.
Reverend Zachary Grant and my minion Matthew Basch.
Lovely couple.
